CHARLES SPRAGUE

Liberty, NYA memorial service will be held for

Charles Sprague on Saturday, June 19, 2004

at St. Paul's Lutheran Church, Chestnut

St., Liberty, at 11 a.m. The Rev. Audrey

Pedersen will officiate.

16, 2004 in Goshen. Doulin Newburgh Funeral

Home Inc. 845-562-0068

Friday, June 11, 2004. Coloni Funeral Home.

845-292-7160

Struble, Clarence H., 82, of Venice, FL,

died June 14, 2004 at home.

Applebee-McPhillips Funeral Home, Inc.

845-343-6309.

Kiriakou, Kaliope "Kelly", 59, of Roscoe,

died Wednesday, June 16, 2004 in Roscoe.

Harris Funeral Home. 607-498-4929

SEVERO CARDOSO

Newburgh, N.Y.Severo Cardoso, a five-year resident of

the area, passed away on June 14, 2004 at

Liberty Street Laundromat. He was 31.He was born June 26 in Mexico.Survivors include his wife Laura De Dios

Cardoso; daughter Diana Cardoso; brothers

and sisters of Mexico; and nieces.Visitation will be held on Thursday, June

17 from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. at

Brooks-DiDoanto Funeral Home, 481 Gidney

Ave., Newburgh.Funeral services will be held at 7 p.m.,

Thursday.Arrangements by Brooks-DiDonato Funeral

Home.

EDWARD A. BOND JR.

Walden, N.Y.Edward A. Bond Jr., a corrections officer

for the Correctional Corps of America,

Spring Hill, Fla., died Tuesday, June 15,

2004 at home. He was 42.The son of Edward and Adrienne Catherine

Malony Bond Sr., he was born June 7, 1962

in Goshen.Survivors include one brother, Ira Bond of

Spring Hill, Fla.; one sister, Adrienne

Lindine of Montgomery; three nieces and one

nephew.There will be no visitation.Private funeral services will be held by

the family.Cremation will be in Cedar Hill Crematory

in Newburgh.Memorial contributions may be made to a

charity of one's choice.Arrangements by Gridley-Horan Funeral

Home.

DONNA LEE CORITZ BAHR

Babylon, N.Y.Donna Lee Coritz Bahr, 64, passed away on

June 4, 2004 after a long illness.Ms. Bahr is the daughter of the late James

W. Coritz, former Police Chief in the town

of New Windsor, and the late Nina DeGroat

Coritz.Ms. Bahr attended New Windsor School,

South Junior High School and graduated from

Newburgh Free Academy in 1957. She also

graduated from Grace Downs School in New

York City.Ms. Bahr is survived by her husband, James

Bahr of Babylon, Long Island; her

daughters, Raina Pentecoste of Islip

Terrace, Long Island, Simone Reilly of

Gilbert, Ariz.; and son, Damon Bahr of Deer

Park, Long Island; five granddaughters; her

sister, Gwendolyn Coritz Nelson of Fairfax

Station, Va.; and several nieces and

nephews.Ms. Bahr and her husband resided at 47

Foster Blvd. South, Babylon, NY 11703.

SHEILA SABBAGH CORBETT

Brooklyn, N.Y.Devoted wife of the late Joseph; cherished

mother of Brian, Lori, Sheila, Mark,

Elizabeth, Christopher, Susan & the late

Joseph; adored grandmother of 16 and

great-grandmother of 2; dear friend of the

late Frank Lisoni.A Mass will be held Saturday, June 19 at

9:30 am at St. Thomas Aquinas Church, 9th

St. & 4th Ave., Brooklyn, N.Y. Reposing will be at the Chapel of Joseph

G. Duffy Funeral Home, 9th St., between 4th

& 5th Ave., Brooklyn, N.Y. with visiting

hours to be held Thurs & Fri from 2 to 5

pm. and from 7 to 9 pm.Arrangements were made by Duffy Funeral

Home. 718-499-8700.

BELLA BOGURSKY

Glen Wild, N.Y.Bella Bogursky, a longtime resident of

Glen Wild, died on Wednesday, June 16, 2004

at home. She was 90.Bella was born in Poland on April 10,

1914, the daughter of Max and Esther

Wisotzky. She was the widow of Charles

Bogursky.She is survived by her son, Jerry Bogursky

and his wife, Lorraine, of Glen Wild; and

her daughter, Ann Bloch and her husband,

Peter, of Ridgefield, N.J.; and her five

grandchildren, Stephen Bogursky and his

wife, Jane, Eileen Marwin and her husband,

Russ, Donna LoTurco and her husband, John,

Robert Bloch and his wife, Laurie, and

Paula Pluchino and her husband, Dan; and

her ten great grandchildren, Anna,

Harrison, Rebecca, Jonah, Maxwell, Justin,

Holly, Jillian, Ian and Magean.Graveside funeral services will be held

today Thursday, June 17, 2004 at 2 p.m. in

the Glen Wild Synagogue Cemetery Marsh Rd,

Glen Wild. Rabbi Irving Goodman will

officiate.Funeral arrangements by Joseph N. Garlick

Funeral Home Inc., 186 Broadway,

Monticello.

HILDA MAE HASTINGS

Wallkill, N.Y.Hilda Mae Hastings of Hamlet of Wallkill,

a Homemaker and resident of the area since

1966 died Wednesday, June 16, 2004, in

Newburgh. She was 67.The daughter of the late Harley Rivers and

Anna Elliot Rivers, she was born August 03,

1936 in Walterboro, South Carolina. She was a member of Mt. Carmel Church of

Christ, Newburgh and of Cyprus Creek

Baptist Church, Walterboro, SC. Survivors include her companion Robert

DeMoney at home; stepson Henry DeMoney of

Middletown; stepdaughter Juana Pure of

Washingtonville; sister Ciela Mae Williams

of Wallkill; nieces nephews. She was predeceased by brothers Franklin

Rivers and Herbert Rivers; sisters Vesa Lee

Thompson, Josephine Jackson, Hollie Rivers

and Betty O'Conner.Arrangements are pending.In Lieu of flowers memorial contributions

may be made to Mt. Carmel Church of Christ,

18 Plattekill Tpk., Newburgh, NY 12550.Arrangements were made by Wallkill Funeral

Home.

GIOVANNI GINO COSTANZO

Milton, N.Y.Giovanni Gino Costanzo, a 44 year resident

of Milton and Control Officer at IBM

Poughkeepsie Warehouse, died June 11, 2004.

He was 75.The son of the late Michael Costanzo and

Carmela Chirichella, he was born December

9, 1928 at Sala Consilino Province.He was the husband of Maria Castrataro.Mr. Costanzo was a member of Sons of Italy

NP, Italian Center Mill Street Park, Lodge

238, Knights of Columbus.Survivors include his wife Maria

Castrataro Costanzo; brother, Vincenzo

Costanzo of Sal Consilina; sister,

Josephine Vespoli Torino; cousins:

Josephine Pape of Highland, Angelo Cavallo

of Newburgh, Salvatore and Lucy Chirichella

of Canada and Antonio and Josephina

Chirichella of Canada, and many nieces and

nephews.The funeral will be held Friday at St.

James Church at 11 a.m. with Father Fred

Kempfirl officiating.Burial will take place in Italy.Vistitation will be Thursday from 4 to 9

p.m. at the DiDonato Funeral Service, 1290

Rt 9W, Marlboro.Arrangements by The DiDonato Funeral

Service, Inc. 1290 Rt 9W P.O. Box 537,

Marlboro.

LEVI L. HAGERDON

Winchester, VALevi Leroy Hagerdon, 89, of Winchester,

VA, passed into peace at the Winchester

Medical Center on May 20, 2004.Born on August 30, 1914 in South Dayton,

NY, "Bing", as he was known in New York,

was a retired dairy farmer and machinist, a

gifted baker, accomplished woodsman and

avid gardener. He was the last surviving

offspring of Frederick and Lois Hagerdon of

Markhams Corners, NY.His wife of 60 years, Camilla Aiken

Hagerdon, preceded in him death.He is survived by two sons: Stephen

Hagerdon of Goshen, NY and Russell Hagerdon

of Berryville, VA; three daughters, Judith

Critelli of Slate Hill, NY, Helen Nason and

Kimberly Unthank of Stokesdale, NC; nine

grandchildren and five great

grandchildren.Final arrangements will be made at the

convenience of the family with Omps Funeral

Home- Amherst Chapel, Winchester, VA.Donations in lieu of flowers may be made

to Blue Ridge Hospice, 333 W. Cork St. #

405, Winchester, VA 22601 or Winchester

Medical Center, 190 Campus Blvd.

Winchester, VA 22601.

HARRY RONES

New Windsor, N.Y.Harry Rones, retired owner of Del-Rons

Boys and Mens Wear in Newburgh, died June

16, 2004 at the Orange County Residential

Health Care Facility. He was 88.The son of the late Max and Fannie Rusch

Rones, he was born August 8, 1915 in Queens

County, N.Y.He was the widower of Blanche Rones.He was a member of the Kerem Lodge of

Masons and Congregation Agudas Israel.Survivors include one son, Joseph and his

wife Ellen Rones of New Windsor; one

brother Irwin Rones of Newburgh; two

granddaughters, Melissa Rones of

Somerville, Mass., Michelle Nobel of

Boston, Mass.He was predeceased by one son, Gerald

Rones.Funeral services will be held at 11 a.m.,

Thursday, June 17 at Congregation Agudas

Israel. Cantor Endre Stamler will

officiateBurial will follow in Congregation Agudas

Israel Cemetery in New Windsor.Donations may be made to Meals of Wheels

of Greater Newburgh, 35 Cerone Place,

Newburgh, NY 12550.Arrangements under the care of the Doulin

Newburgh Funeral Home Inc.

HOWARD C. BROWN SR. "REV"

New Windsor, N.Y.Howard C. Brown Sr. "Rev", a retired auto

mechanic, United States Military Academy,

West Point, died Saturday, June 12, 2004 at

St. Luke's Cornwall Hospital, Newburgh

Campus. He was 82.The son of the late James Madison Brown

and Lula Kilgore Brown, he was born June

18, 1921 in Hampton, Va.Survivors include his loving and devoted

wife of 36 years, Jill Scruggs Brown; two

sons, Howard C. Brown Jr. of San Francisco,

Calif., David Brown of Newburgh; one

daughter, Lisa Brown Newman and husband

Bobby of Newburgh; one sister, Margaret

Brown Smith of Hampton, Va.; three

grandchildren Celia Walker Oscar of

Manhattan, Kans., Laquise and Imani Newman

both of Woodbridge, N.Y.; one

great-grandchild, Carrington Jai Walker of

Manhattan, Kans.; several nieces, nephews

and other relatives and friends.He was predeceased by four brothers,

George, David, Lawrence, Homer Brown and

sister, Louise Brown Summerville.Visitation will be held at Rhodes Funeral

Home, 259 Walsh Ave., New Windsor on

Wednesday, June 16 from 6 to 8 p.m.Rhodes Funeral Home, entrusted with

professional arrangements.

RUTH SMITH

Smithville Flats, N.Y.Ruth Smith, 81, died June 11, 2004 at

Chenango Memorial Hospital in Norwich.She was born April 9, 1923 in Ellenville,

the daughter of the late Ralph and Jennie

Smith. She was married to the late William

Smith who predeceased her in 1996.She was a former member of St. Marks

United Methodist Church in Napanoch.Surviving are two sons: William Smith and

his wife Colleen of Clovis, N.M. and Ernest

Smith and his wife Kathy of Smithville

Flats; three daughters: Vivian Mahoney and

her husband John of Gatlinburg, TN, Jane

Smith and her husband Larry of Napanoch and

Marion Coppola of Whitestone, N.Y.; twenty

seven grandchildren and several great

grandchildren; and one great great

grandchild.She was predeceased by three sisters and

one brother.Funeral service will be held 11 a.m.

Tuesday June 15, 2004 at H.B. Humiston

Funeral Home, Inc. 30 Forty Second St.,

Kerhonkson.Burial will be in Cherrytown Cemetery.Family will receive friends Monday from 7

to 9 p.m. at the H.B. Humiston Funeral

Home, Kerhonkson.In lieu of flowers, contributions to Jane

Smith, 514 Maple Lane, Napanoch, NY 12458.

KATHRYN L. DOWLING

Ellenville, N.Y.Kathryn L. Dowling, of Ellenville, a

lifelong resident and former head teller at

the First National Bank and Trust Company,

Ellenville, died June 16, 2004 in

Ellenville Regional Hospital. She was 85.The daughter of James and Ida Viette

Daharsh, she was born Oct. 23, 1918 in

Wawarsing.She was a member of the Ellenville United

Methodist Church.Survivors include her brother, Robert

Dowling of Ellenville; nieces and nephews,

Barbara Kanter of Connecticut, Patricia

Dowling of New Jersey, Bonnie Dowling of

Ortega, R.I., Wayne Dowling of R.I., Thomas

Dowling of Brooklyn, Edward Dowling of

Arizona; several grandnieces and nephews.She was predeceased by her brother, Edward

Dowling.Friends may call at the Loucks Funeral

Home Inc., Route 209, Ellenville from 2 to

4 and 7 to 9 p.m. on Friday, June 18.Funeral services will be held Saturday,

June 19 at 10 a.m. at the funeral home with

the Rev. Louise Thomas officiating.Burial will be in Fantinekill Cemetery,

Ellenville.Donations may be made to the Ellenville

First Aid and Rescue Squad, Webster St.,

Ellenville, NY 12428.Arrangements by Loucks Funeral Home.

LIONEL HARRIS KELLY JR.

Sullivan County, N.Y.Lionel Harris Kelly Jr., a longtime

Sullivan County resident, died on Monday,

June 14, 2004 at the Sullivan County Adult

Care Center in Liberty. He was 63.Mr. Kelly was born in Gaspe' Canada on

June 16, 1940 to the late Lionel Harris and

Beatrice Gagna' Kelly. Mr. Kelly was a

retired lineman for A and A Electric Co. in

Chicago, Ill.Mr. Kelly is survived by three sons,

Joseph and his fianc?e, Tennille of

Hurleyville, and Mark and Jason of

Monticello; two daughters, Wendy Kelly of

Rock Hill, and Anita Kelly of Monticello;

two brothers, Wayne Kelly of Chicago, Ill.,

and Gary Kelly of Montreal, Canada; one

sister, Paula Finette of Canada; 15

grandchildren; and several nieces and

nephews.He was predeceased by one son, Jesse W.

Kelly; and one sister, Elizabeth (Betty)

Bond.Friends may call at Ramsay's Funeral

Homes, Inc., 55 Saint John Street,

Monticello on Friday, June 18 from 9 to

9:45 a.m. A Mass of Christian Burial will

take place at St. Peter's Roman Catholic

Church, Broadway and Liberty Street,

Monticello at 10 a.m. The Rev. John Tran

will officiate.Burial will follow in St. Joseph's

Cemetery, Wurtsboro.Arrangements by Ramsay's Funeral Homes,

Inc., Monticello.

HARRY ROSS

Liberty, N.Y.Harry Ross, a longtime resident of

Liberty, and founder of Ross Electric

Company, died Tuesday, June 15, 2004 in

Boca Raton, Fla. He was 87.The son of Katie and Hyman Rosenstein, he

was born August 2, 1916 in Philadelphia,

Pa.Harry was a member and secretary-treasurer

of the Ferndale Synagogue, a charter member

of the Liberty Ambulance Corp., a member of

the Knights of Pythias, the international

Association of Electrical Inspectors and

the Oddfellows.He is survived by his wife of 67 years,

Rose Ross, at home; his daughter, Carol

Baumann and her husband, Jerry Koenig, of

Margate, Fla.; son, Joel Ross and his wife,

Joan, of Liberty; grandchildren, Steven

Ross, and his wife, Micky, of Liberty,

Kenneth Ross and his wife, Tracy, of

Liberty, Rick Ross and his wife, Sandi, of

Boynton Beach, Fla., Jason Baumann and his

wife, Tracy, of Boca Raton, Fla., and

Daniel Baumann and his wife, Christine, of

California; great-grandchildren, Joshua,

Nicole, Esti, Allison, Caelian Ross and

Kelsey Baumann.Services will be held at — p.m. on Friday,

June 18 at the Joseph N. Garlick Funeral

Home, 186 Broadway, Monticello, with Rabbi

Marvin Goldman officiating. Burial will be

at the Ferndale Synagogue Cemetery in

Parksville.Memorial contributions may be made to the

charity of one's choice.

JOHN W. JACK ADAMS

Accord, N.Y.John W. Jack Adams, a Sheet Metal Worker,

died June 16, 2004 at Ellenville Hospital.

He was 74.Son of Elvin Adams and Anna Mae

Fredericks, both deceased, he was born

February 4, 1930 in Cornwall, NY.He was a member of St. John Episcopal

Church, Ellenville and a Sheet Metal Worker

for Local # 38, Brewster, NY.Survivors include his sons: Gary and wife

Anne Adams of Accord, NY and James and wife

Mary Adams of New Hampton,NY; brother, Roy

Adams of Newburgh; sisters: Helen Foster of

Gloversville, NY and Ruth Gowdy of Ocala,

FL; grandchildren: Heather Adams and

Fiancee Joseph Martelli, David Adams, Kelly

and husband Michael Grant, Michelle Adams

and Sarah Adams; one great grandchild,

Jocelyn Grant, as well as several nieces

and nephews.He was predeceased by his wife Helen

Thorne Adams.The funeral will be held at the DiDonato

Funeral Home, Saturday, June 19, 2004 at

10:30 a.m.Burial will take place June 19, 2004 in

the Fostertown Cemetery Located at

Newburgh, NY.Visitation will be Friday from 2 to 4 and

6 to 8 p.m. at the funeral home.Arrangements by The DiDonato Funeral

Service, Inc., 1290 Rt 9W, Marlboro, NY

JEANETTE I. KOECHEL

Westport, N.Y.Jeanette I. Koechel, 65, died Monday, June

14 at her home. She was born August 28,

1938 in Bronx, N.Y., the daughter of

Emmanualle and Perina (Borgi)

Christodolus.She enjoyed writing, gardening and

traveling. She was very active as a

Volunteer for the Families First, Al-A-Non,

as a driver for the Office for the Aging

and served the Literacy Volunteers of

America, as a board member as well as a

tutor.She is survived by her husband, David

James Koechel of Westport, her children and

their spouses: David and Roann Koechel of

Milton, NY, Donna and Robert Thompson of

Westport, Daniel Koechel of Lewis, Debra

and James Kahler of Westport, Karen and

Richard Larsen of Goshen, NY, two nephews:

Michael Koechel of Marlboro, NY and Stephen

and Rita Koechel of Kingston, NY; one

brother, Nicholas and Jeanette Christodolus

of Pensicola, FL; two sisters: Marie

Christodolus, of Kingston, NY, Georgia and

Wayne Rarich of Kingston, NY and nine

grandchildren.Calling hours will be held Thursday from —

to — p.m. at W.M. Marvin's Sons Funeral

Home in Elizabethtown. A celebration of her

life will be held at — p.m. also at the

funeral home.Donations in her memory may be made to the

Literacy Volunteers of America,

Essex-Franklin Chapter, Hospital Rd.,

Mineville, NY 12956.

STANLEY J. URBAN

Newburgh, N.Y.Stanley J. Urban (Pop), 86, of Orange

Lake, died peacefully at his home on

Friday, June 11, 2004 following a short

illness.He was born December 6, 1917 in Port

Chester to Alice and Stanley J. Urban. He

was a graduate of Port Chester High School

and served with the Army Tank Corps in

North Africa during World War II. He

retired from Central Hudson in 1977 after

38 years.He married Doris Lang in May 1944 and they

spent 50 wonderful years together until her

passing on August 24, 1994. Pop loved to

play golf and drive his favorite Jeep

"Popeye". If anyone needed help, he was

always there doing whatever he could. He

will be remembered as a kind, caring and

loving person. He was a 50 year member of

the American Legion Post 1420, a member of

the VFW, and the Dan Leghorn Fire Dept.He is survived by his son, Stanley and his

wife, Kathy, of Austin, Texas; his

daughter, Donna Pizarro and her husband,

Bill, of Fishkill; a grandson, Stanley Jr.

who resided in Japan; three granddaughters,

Doriann Pizarro of the Town of

Poughkeepsie, Katherine Pizarro of

Manhattan, and Jennifer Urban of San

Antonio, Texas.There will be no visitation.A memorial service for friends and family

will be held at 9 a.m. on Saturday, June

19, 2004 at Our Lady of the Lake Church,

Orange Lake. "For a family guestbook and

directions visit colonifuneralhome.com"

DONALD MATTHEWS

Middletown, N.Y.Donald Matthews of Middletown, died on

Monday, June 16, 2004 at Orange Regional

Medical Center in Middletown. He was 81.The son of the late Thomas E. and Thelma

North Matthews, he was born on February 15,

1923 in Norwich. Mr. Matthews married Vicki

Coser on September 2, 1944 in Dayton,

Ohio.He served his country as a radio operator

in the US Air Force during World War II.

Donald earned three bronze medals during

his military carrer as well as the Asiastic

Pacific Ribbon for his time in New Guinea,

India. He was employed as a supervisory

electrician for Orange and Rockland

Utilities and was a member of the

Railroader Historical Society.A family statement reads: "He led a

facinating life. He loved the water,

lighthouses and the railroad. Donald was

devoted to his family, especially his wife

of 60 years. He was easy-going and had a

good sense of humor, and made friends

easily. His wife and family are grateful

for the support and care his many friends

at Horton Hospital provided him."Donald is survived by his wife Vicki, at

home; his daughter, Diane Elaine LeRoy and

her husband Bill; and one grandson, Scott

Le Roy, all of Wappingers Falls; and one

niece and one nephew.There will be no visitation or memorial

service. Cremation will take place at the

convenience of the family.Arrangments under the direction of

Applebee McPhillips Funeral Home, Inc.

www.applebee-mcphillips.com

ASHLEY LYNN MORGAN

Monticello, N.Y.Ashley Lynn Morgan, a freshman at

Monticello High School, died unexpectedly

on Tuesday, June 15, 2004 in the Town of

Thompson. She was 15 years old. Born January 27, 1989 in Schenectady,

Ashley was on the Monticello High School

Varsity Golf Team as well as a member of

the Debate Team. She is survived by her parents, Linda and

Joseph Kenny and her expected little

brother at home; her grandparents, Bill &

Marie Morgan of No. Miami Beach & Kiamesha

Lake, Karen & Matt Donnelly, of Halfmoon,

NY, & Sandy Kenny, of Monticello; Aunts &

Uncles, Scott & Jen, Rick & Jen, Jill &

Jeff, Stacey & Vinny; and several cousins,

as well as many close friends.Visitation for Ashley and her best friend

Sierra Cerrone, will be held on Friday,

June 18 from 3-7pm at the VanInwegen-Kenny,

Inc. Funeral Home, 401 Broadway,

Monticello. Their funeral mass will be held on

Saturday, June 19, at 1:00pm at the St.

Peter's Church, Broadway & Liberty St.,

Monticello with the Rev. Robert Ginel

officiating.Burial will be in St. Peter's Cemetery,

Monticello.In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions

may be made to a memorial fund for Ashley &

Sierra to be determined at a later date.

These donations may be made directly to the

families.Funeral Arrangements are by the

VanInwegen-Kenny Funeral Home of

Monticello. For further service details,

please go to www.kennyfuneralhome.com.

PATRICIA "Pat" (WILLIAMS) WEBER

Mountaindale, N.Y.Patricia "Pat" Williams Weber, died on

Wednesday, June 16, 2004 in White Plains

Hospital. She was 47. The daughter of Walter and Joan Miller

Williams, she was born on February 07, 1957

in Liberty, New York. Pat was a Registered Nurse at the Sullivan

County Adult Care Center. A Family Statement Read: Pat was a loving

& caring wife, mother, grandmother, friend

and caregiver. Her wit and humor brought

smiles to everyone she met. She will be

missed by all who had the pleasure of

knowing her. Those who never had the chance

they will never know. Survivors include, her husband Stuart, who

she married in August of 2002, at home; two

sons, Gillian Trujillo of Parksville;

Kenneth Alger, III and his wife Gillian of

Comstock, New York; one daughter, Amanda

Alger of Mountaindale; her parents, Walter

Williams of Damascus, PA; and Joan Miller

Mereos of Parksville; one sister Susan

Riesner of Livingston Manor; one grandson,

Jivan Alger of Mountaindale; an aunt &

uncle, Joyce and Glen Schmidt of

Youngsville as well as several aunt, uncles

and cousins. Visitation will be held at the Herbert C.

Bryant Funeral Home, 29 Pearl Street,

Livingston Manor, NY from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

PM on Friday, June 18, 2004. Funeral services will be held on Saturday

at 11 a.m. at the funeral home.Donations may be made to the Residence

Counsel, PO Box 671, Liberty, New York

12754.Arrangements are under the direction of

Herbert C. Bryant Funeral Home.

DOROTHY I. VAN ETTEN

Manistee, Mich.Dorothy I. Van Etten, age 91, died early

Tuesday morning June 15, 2004 at Green

Acres Retirement Living Home in Manistee,

Mich. where she resided.She was born on November 24, 1912 in Pine

Bush, N.Y., daughter of the late Frank and

Jennie (Meredith) Courtright.Dorothy is survived by her daughter and

son-in-law, Patricia and Fred Fragomeli of

Fragomeli of Ft. Worth, Texas, Lisa

Fragomeli of Manistee, Mich., Lance and

Barb Fragomeli of Woodbridge, Va., Lori

Fragomeli of St. Louis, Mo. and Lane

Fragomeli of San Deigo, Calif.; four

great-grandchildren, Aaron and Logan Harmon

and Luke and Matthew Fragomeli; four

stepchildren, Jan and Alice Van Etten,

Richard and Geri Van Etten, Robert and

Patricia Van Etten and Margaret and David

Coats; several stepgrandchildren; and

step-great-grandchildren; one brother and

sister-in-law, Richard and Barbara

Courtright; four sisters and one

brother-in-law, Elise Shaw, Hazel and

Harvey Lybolt, Vera Mulligan and Bea Sands;

and numerous nieces and nephews.She was preceded in death by her husband,

Kenneth Easman and her second husband

Richard Van Etten; by two granddaughters,

Lynn P. Fragomeli and Lauren B. Fragomeli;

her brothers, George and Kenneth

Courtright; her sisters, Ruth Damms, Jennie

Rinaldi, Margaret Rainy and Edna Scott.According to her wishes, cremation has

taken place and there will be no services

at this time.The Herbert Funeral Home of Manistee is in

charge of funeral arrangements.

SIERRA LYNN CERRONE

Harris, N.Y.Sierra Lynn Cerrone, a freshman at

Monticello High School, died unexpectedly

on Tuesday, June 15, 2004 in the Town of

Thompson. She was 14 years old. Born October 13, 1989 in Johnson City,

Sierra was on the Monticello High School

Varsity Golf Team as well as a member of

the Debate Team. She was the beloved

daughter of Joseph & Joan Cerrone; She was

a great sister and will be sadly missed by

family includes many cousins, great aunts

and uncles, and many close friends.Visitation for Sierra and her best friend

Ashley Morgan, will be held on Friday, June

18 from 3-7pm at the VanInwegen-Kenny, Inc.

Funeral Home, 401 Broadway, Monticello.Their funeral mass will be held on

Saturday, June 19, at 1:00pm at the St.

Peter's Church, Broadway & Liberty St.,

Monticello with the Rev. Robert Ginel

officiating. Burial will be in St. Peter's Cemetery,

Monticello. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions

may be made to a memorial fund for Sierra &

Ashley to be determined at a later date.

CLARENCE H. "BILL" STRUBLE

Venice, Fla.

Formerly of Slate Hill, N.Y.Clarence "Bill" Struble of Venice, Fla.,

died Monday, June 14, 2004 at home with his

loving wife by his side. He was 82 years

old.The son of the late Harold and Edith Hayes

Struble, he was born October 12, 1921 on a

farm in Mount Hope, New York.A veteran of World War II, he proudly

served in the United States Army. Bill is

also known as a short order chef for

various restaurants in the area such as The

Colonial Diner and Coney Island.A family statement reads, "He was a true

outdoorsman; he enjoyed ice fishing and

camping, but deep sea fishing was his

favorite past time. He will always be

affectionately known as Bill, Dad, and

Poppy."He is survived by his wife, Tina, at home;

five sons: Harold "Butch" and his wife,

Margy, of Ridgebury, Lyn and his wife,

Carol, of Middletown, Burt and his wife,

Bertha, of Middletown, Kenneth "Skip" and

his wife, Karen, of Slate Hill, and Thomas

and his wife, Deborah, of Knoxville, TN;

two daughters: Delores "Dee" Leibler and

her husband, Anthony "Tex", of Slate Hill,

and Rosemary Capobianco and her husband,

Paul, of Siesta Keys, Fla.; one sister,

Edna "Sis" Flood of Johnson; one sister-in-

law, Jean Rollings and her husband,

Raymond, of Scotchtown; fourteen

grandchildren; nine great grandchildren;

several nieces and nephews; and many

friends both of Florida and New York.Bill is predeceased by his first wife,

Roseann Norman Struble; two sons, Robert

and William; three grandchildren, Lori,

Melissa, and Kimberly; and one brother,

Lawrence "Larry" Struble.Cremation will be private and at the

convenience of the family.A Funeral Service of Remembrance will be

announced at a later date.Arrangements under the direction of

Applebee McPhillips Funeral Home, Inc.

www.applebee-mcphillips.com

JOSEPH E. COSTIC

Greenville, N.Y.Mr. Joseph E. Costic, of Greenville, N.Y.,

lifetime resident of the area, died

Tuesday, June 15, 2004 at home with his

family by his side. He was 87.He was born January 1, 1917 in Greenville,

N.Y., the son of the late Paul and the late

Mary Krawicz Costic.Joseph retired from the Dept. of Gas

Electric and Water Supply for the City of

New York after 25 years. Joseph was a

member of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel,

Middletown, N.Y. Joseph proudly served his

country during World War II in the United

States Army as a 1st Sgt. He was a member

of the Greenville Memorial Post #3175 where

he served as Chaplain and Service Officer.

Surviving are: his wife: Margaret "Peggy"

Costic At Home; son: Dr. Joseph Costic &

his wife Denise Mt. Laurel, NJ; daughter:

Margaret Costic Greenville, NY; brother

George Costic & his wife Sophie Middletown,

NY; — grandchildren: Thomas Costic,

Jennifer Costic and Sean Costic; also

several nieces and nephews; sister-in-law

Catherine Griff Cape Cod, MA;He was predeceased by four brothers:

Michael, John, Paul & Steve Costic; two

sisters: Nancy Lysogorski & Tillie Bergen;

and his faithful dog Tess.Friends may call at the Gray-Parker

Funeral Home, 100 E. Main St., Port Jervis

on Friday, June 18th from 2 - 4pm & 7-9pm

with VFW services at 7:30 p.m.Funeral services will be held on Saturday,

June 19th with an 10 a.m. Mass of the

Resurrection in Holy Cross R.C. Church,

County Route 22, South Centerville, NY with

Rev. Robert Porpora and Father Frank Dixon

concelebrating.Burial with Military Honors will be at St.

Mary's Cemetery, Port Jervis, NY.Memorial contributions may be made to

Hospice of Orange and Sullivan County, 800

Stony Brook Rd., Newburgh, NY 12550 Or The

Heart Hospital at St. Francis Medical Ctr.,

601 Hamilton Ave., Trenton, NJ 08629.For information, directions or to send a

condolence note to the family visit

www.grayparkerfuneralhome.com

Funeral arrangements are by the Gray-Parker

Funeral Home.

RALPH P. SANTILLO JR.

Newburgh, N.Y.Ralph P. Santillo Jr., a lifelong resident

of Newburgh, entered into rest Monday, June

14, 2004 in St. Luke's Hospital, Newburgh.

He was 70. Son of the late Ralph and Veronica Danko

Santillo, he was born February 24, 1934 in

Newburgh. He was married to the late Lois

VanVlack Santillo, who predeceased him in

1990. Ralph proudly served his country in the US

Army. He was a devoted former member of Our

Lady of Hope and a recent parishioner of

St. Mary's Church in Newburgh. His many

contributions and dedication to his

community and to his family will be

remembered by all who knew him. He was an

honorable individual whose love and

devotion will never be forgotten. He will

be dearly missed. Survivors include his children, Ralph P.

Santillo III and his wife Angela of Cairo;

Darlene Santillo of Deltona, FL, Michael

Sweeney of Kingston, Kevin Thomas and his

wife Jill of Montgomery, Thomas P. Santillo

and his fianc?e Pamela Stafford of

Newburgh, Anne Carmichael and her husband

Gordon of Coxsackie, James C. Henry and

Lawrence C. Henry and his wife Patty, all

of New Windsor, and Lori Henry of Port

Jervis; his brother, John Santillo and his

wife Valerie of Chatham; his sister,

Veronica Cottle of Jennings, FL;

grandchildren, Veronica, Miranda, Jacob,

Kaitlyn, Shannon, Skyler, Abigail,

Michelle, Thomas, Emily, Ethan, Emily,

Kyle, Kevin, April, Lisa, James, Jamie,

Cassidy, Christopher, Angela, Kathy, Lois,

Jason, Desire, Tiffany, Raymond and Jimmy;

great grandchildren, Desire, Kayla and

Brooks; and several aunts, uncles, nieces,

nephews, cousins, and an abundance of

loving friends. In addition to his wife, he was

predeceased by two brothers, Carmen and

Joseph Santillo. Visitation will be held from 2-4 & 6-8 pm

on Friday, June 18 at the Brooks-DiDonato

Funeral Home, 481 Gidney Ave., Newburgh. A Mass of Christian Burial will be

celebrated at 1:30 pm on Saturday, June 19

in St. Mary's Church, Newburgh. Burial will follow in Calvary Cemetery,

New Windsor. To send a personal condolence or for

directions to the funeral home, please

visit Brooks-DiDonato.com.

CHARLENE KLIEVERIK

Goshen, N.Y.Charlene Klieverik of Goshen, surrounded

by her family, died peacefully at her home

on June 14, 2004.Beloved wife of Ronald and devoted mother

of Alexander, dear daughter of Bertha Smith

and the late Richard Smith, Charlene died

of cancer.A teaching assistant at the Middle School

of Goshen, Charlene was cherished by

countless computer class students and

appreciated as a colleague and friend by

many faculty members.With the assistance of many others, she

played a major role in establishing The

Goshen Science Olympiad Organization, an

active parent organization that supports

the Goshen Science Olympiad Program.A very talented quilter and homemaker, she

is lovingly remembered by her many friends

in the Goshen community and elsewhere.Charlene was born and grew up in Kingston,

N.H. She was a graduate of the Sanborn

Seminary High School in Kingston, N.H. and

the University of New Hampshire at

Plymouth, N.H. She subsequently pursued a

business career in New York where she met

her husband Ron. After their marriage in

Holland in 1983, they resided in Roseland,

N.J. and Wilbraham, Mass. before moving to

Holland in 1990. The Klieveriks returned to

the U.S. in 1995 and settled in Goshen.Survivors include her husband of 21 years,

Ronald Klieverik; son, Alexander Klieverik

of Goshen; her mother Bertha Smith of

Hampton, N.H.; her sister, Dianne

Smith-Lambias and her husband, Charles of

Hampton, N.H.; aunts, Connie Rowe of

Newton, N.H. and Helen Stukas of Kingston,

N.H.; cousins, Steven Rowe and his wife,

Mary Keeler Rowe, of Newton, N.H. and

Christine Cordey of Jackson Heights.Visitation will be at Donovan's Funeral

Home in Goshen on Friday, June 18 from 7 to

9 p.m. and Saturday, June 19 from 10 to 11

a.m. A funeral service will be held at

Donovan's Funeral Home on Saturday, June 19

at 11 a.m. followed by burial at Wallkill

Cemetery.In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions

may be made to: The Goshen Science Olympiad

Organization, c/o Kathy Mallard, 9 Camelot

Drive, Goshen NY 10924. Contributions will

be dedicated to The Goshen Olympiad

Scholarship Fund.A memorial service will be held for

Charlene in Kingston, N.H. at a future

date.Arrangements made by the Donovan Funeral

Home, Goshen.
